intro: Ottonia mendoncae, commonly known as the Mendenhall's ottonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the United States. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, violet-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Ottonia mendoncae has small, heart-shaped leaves and produces clusters of fragrant blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
